alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 11:53PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In Kansas, Sherman and Wallace. * WHEN...Until 300 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated residual flooding from earlier rainfall. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Turtle Creek, Middle Fork Lake Creek, South Fork Lake Creek, Lake Creek, Sandy Creek, NF Smoky Hill, Smoky Hill River, Willow Creek, Big Timber Creek, Smoky Hill, Goose Creek and North Fork Smoky Hill River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Cheyenne, Southeastern Kit Carson, Southwestern Sherman and Northwestern Wallace Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
